security_audit.summary: No malicious patterns detected. Scripts perform local file and directory operations consistent with initializing, validating, and packaging skills.

medium_findings.title: Packages arbitrary directory contents into zip
medium_findings.description: The packager zips all files under a user-supplied path. This matches purpose, but can accidentally include secrets if the skill folder contains them.

low_findings.title: No validation of skill-name constraints
low_findings.description: CLI help text states naming constraints, but init_skill does not enforce them. This can create malformed or unexpected directories.

low_findings.title: Import path mismatch for validator
low_findings.description: Imports `from quick_validate import validate_skill`, but the validator shown is `scripts/quick/validate.py` with `validate_skill`. If module resolution differs, packaging may fail or use an unintended module.

low_findings.title: Overly strict frontmatter delimiter parsing
low_findings.description: Frontmatter extraction regex requires `---\n` exact newlines and may fail on Windows line endings or additional spacing, causing false validation failures.

content.user_title: Create Claude Skills from a Standard Template
content.value_statement: Stop starting each skill from scratch. Generate a consistent skill folder with SKILL.md, scripts, references, and assets, then validate and package it.
actual_capabilities: Initialize a new skill directory with a prefilled `SKILL.md` template and TODO placeholders
Create example resource folders (`scripts/`, `references/`, `assets/`) with starter files
Validate `SKILL.md` frontmatter for required fields and allowed keys using YAML safe loading
Package a completed skill folder into a distributable `.skill` (zip) file after validation
Provide reference docs for workflow patterns and output formatting patterns
limitations: Validator focuses on `SKILL.md` frontmatter and does not deeply inspect scripts, references, or assets for quality
Packaging includes all files under the skill folder and can unintentionally include sensitive files if they are present
No network publishing or marketplace upload is included; it only builds local folders and a `.skill` archive
Naming constraints are described in CLI help but not enforced by the initializer code shown

use_cases.title: Draft a New Internal Skill
use_cases.description: Start a new skill with a consistent structure and write clear triggering metadata.

use_cases.title: Create Repeatable Skill Templates
use_cases.description: Use the template and reference patterns to produce skills with consistent workflows and output formats.

use_cases.title: Package Skills for Distribution
use_cases.description: Validate skills before sharing and bundle them into a `.skill` file for teammates.

prompt_templates.title: Beginner: New Skill Outline
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me define the name and description for a new Claude skill that helps with <domain>. Give 5 example user requests that should trigger it.

prompt_templates.title: Intermediate: Template-Based Build
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the skill-creator approach to propose a SKILL.md structure for <skill-name>. Include a short workflow and list what should go in scripts/, references/, and assets/.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced: Validation Readiness
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this SKILL.md frontmatter and tell me if it will pass validation. Then suggest edits to make the description more specific about when to use the skill.

prompt_templates.title: Expert: Distribution Checklist
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a packaging checklist for <skill-folder>. Include steps to ensure no secrets are included, and confirm the skill is valid before building the .skill file.

output_examples.input: Propose a SKILL.md structure for a 'log-triage' skill
output: Workflow decision tree for: collect logs → classify issue → recommend next actions
List of reusable scripts to add (e.g., log sampler, redaction helper)
Reference docs to include (e.g., common error signatures, escalation policy)
Output template for incident summary and next steps

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md concise and move long material into `references/`
Write the frontmatter description with clear triggering scenarios and file types
Package only after removing example placeholders and checking for secrets in the skill folder
anti_patterns: Avoid adding extra documentation files like README.md or changelogs that do not help execution
Avoid putting detailed "when to use" guidance only in the body instead of the frontmatter description
Avoid packaging a skill folder that contains credentials, tokens, or local environment files

faq.question: What does this skill help me do?
faq.answer: It guides you through creating a skill, scaffolds a skill folder with templates, validates SKILL.md frontmatter, and packages the folder into a .skill archive.

faq.question: Is it compatible with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It is designed to help structure and generate SKILL.md and bundled resources that Claude Code can use as a skill.

faq.question: Does it integrate with external APIs or tools?
faq.answer: Not directly. It provides patterns and local scripts for scaffolding, validation, and packaging, but no external service integration is included.

faq.question: Is my data safe when packaging?
faq.answer: Packaging is local, but it will include any files inside the skill folder. Remove secrets and unwanted files before creating the .skill archive.

faq.question: Why did validation fail even though my YAML looks correct?
faq.answer: The validator expects a specific frontmatter delimiter format and certain allowed keys. Ensure the file starts with '---' and only uses supported frontmatter fields.

faq.question: How does this compare to writing a skill manually?
faq.answer: Manual creation works, but the template and reference patterns reduce omissions, keep structure consistent, and make validation and packaging more repeatable.
